data.title: Canaima National Park
data.text: Canaima National Park is a park in south eastern Venezuela that roughly occupies the same area as the Gran Sabana region It is located in Bolvar State reaching the borders with Brazil and Guyana The park was named a World Heritage Site by UNESCO History Canaima National Park was established on 12 June 1962 As early as 1990 the countries that participate in the Amazonian Cooperation Treaty had recommended expanding the Canaima National Park southward to connect it with Monte Roraima National Park in Brazil with coordinated management of tourism research and conservation
